What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Coloboma of iris

You are a patient: You are 28 and your biological gender is female.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- A noticeable black defect in the iris of your right eye
- Slight double vision and blurred vision when looking at distant objects
- Decreased clarity and some ghost imaging, especially in bright light
These symptoms came into fruition gradually over the past few months, with the black spot becoming more prominent and your vision occasionally feeling distorted. You recall that your mother had hypothyroidism during pregnancy and that there’s a family history of ocular anomalies. You’re concerned because these changes seem to be worsening and are affecting your daily activities.
